item.title: Image Description: BLM5280 letterhead featuring our Denver...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Image Description:
BLM5280 letterhead featuring our Denver skyline logo with black text on an offehite background reads:

RE: The Office of Independent Monitor George Floyd Protest Report

...

December 8, 2020

Upon reviewing the Office of the Independent Monitor's report analyzing the Denver Police Department’s (DPD) response to the 2020 protests, most of the findings are no surprise to us. Since we organized the May 28th protest, we have condemned their use of military grade munitions on protestors in the Denver and Aurora communities. The report highlights a number of policy and civil rights violations against protestors, including use of force and excessive force complaints, lack of record keeping when using force, the lack of dispersal orders, and disabling body worn cameras. These violations are the very ones that protestors were protesting against.

Our own chapter members and community members shared stories about exposure to chemical weapons, resulting in both physical and emotional harm. Our chapter diverted crisis funds to community to aid injured protestors in getting adequate care for their physical injuries and receiving financial support for mental health care and healing. At Today's DPD press conference there was no discussion of how DPD or the City of Denver will repair harm to those who were emotionally and/or physically injured by DPD, including the multiple individuals who lost their eyes. Again, our ACLU federal lawsuit is under review at this time, which aims to hold the city accountable for First Amendment violations against protestors.

BLM5280 will continue to engage in direct actions holding DPD accountable for the mistreatment of Black people, as we have been doing since 2015. We will continue to hold appointed officials accountable, including the Denver City Council who supported the 2021-2022 DPD budget despite community members expressing these concerns throughout the summer. BLM statements are meaningless without legislative changes to protect community. We will continue to demand justice for Elijah McClain and countless others in our community and their families who have yet to receive justice. Lastly, we support the recommendations enumerated in the OIM's report in order to increase accountability from DPD. In sum, the OIM report only highlights what we've already known and we will continue our work


It is our duty to fight for our freedom.
It is our duty to win.
Black Lives Matter 5280

See More

In the past 2 months, our Displacement Defense Fund has kept 25 Black and Brown families in their homes. On #COGivesDay support #MutualAid coloradogives.org/blacklivesmatter5280 https://denverite.com/…/denvers-black-lives-matter-organiz…/ #COGivesDay

Denver’s Black Lives Matter organization has helped 13 families stay housedBlack Lives Matter 5280 used a Colorado Trust grant for its rent relief program.Denver’s Black Lives Matter organization has helped 13 families stay housedBlack Lives Matter 5280 used a Colorado Trust grant for its rent relief program.See more at DENVERITE.COM

Black Lives Matter 5280

With donations like yours, BLM5280 will be able to offer an EXTENDED 2021 Freedom School where we will provide FREE, liberative, affirming education for our babies. All meals, technology and supplies are always free of charge to our beautiful families. Support here this #COGivesDay cologardogives.org/blacklivesmatter5280

...

I would lend you my voice if you asked .. and you told me that your family was being murdered everyday and the world turned a blind eye. So you ain’t even gotta be from Tigray , from Ethiopia, Eritrea ,or Africa to speak out against GENOCIDE.

Please help be a voice for the collective existence of my FAMILY .

item.title: “Please sign the petition and share! 3 APD officers who...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

“Please sign the petition and share! 3 APD officers who re-enacted Elijah’s death, by taking photos,at the same place he was murdered; they are going in front of Aurora’s Civil Service Commission to get their jobs back 12/7. This is 2020 and they played a commonly known page from Jim Crow. These are supposed to be those that “serve and protect” in the most diverse community in Colorado. Random acts of violence knows no affiliation. Regardless of the aisle you sit on, we can a...ll agree that a man walking home from the gas station shouldn’t be subject to murder, committing no crime. That was a son, a brother, a friend, and a light in our community. Many of us are still grieving, but we always put in the work. I’m asking everyone else to participate in the change that needs to happen. That young man was a majestic unicorn in the valleys. If you knew him, I hope you push, those who didn’t, you better.”
#JusticeForElijahMcclain

See More2433 signatures are still needed! Against the Reinstating of Aurora Police Officers in the Elijah McClain case!

change.org

Can you spare a minute to help April Young?

2433 signatures are still needed! Against the Reinstating of Aurora Police Officers in the Elijah McClain case!2433 signatures are still needed! Against the Reinstating of Aurora Police Officers in the Elijah McClain case!

item.title: Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will continue to share links to bail/legal support fundraising in Denver, Minneapolis and beyond. We encourage friends to donate to BLM5280’s Emergency Fund using Venmo http://venmo.com/BLM5280 . These donations will be used for bail, legal support, and provision of direct services for Black people impacted by the current and ongoing crisis. If you would like to make a tax-deductible donation that we will have access to at a later date, you can visit our Colorado Gives Day Page to donate through our fiscal sponsor, Rocky Mountain Peace and Justice Center.

Working with residents and organizations in Denver, Black Lives Matter 5280 assists in building more loving and united Black communities while eliminating anti-Black violence and racism. To expose, address and eradicate structures and systems of oppression in Denver, BLM5280 uses a holistic racial j...
